alert.note: Alert for Brown; Clermont; Highland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 16 at 10:29AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive runoff and additional rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of South Central Ohio and Southwest Ohio, including the following counties, in South Central Ohio, Highland. In Southwest Ohio, Brown and Clermont. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1028 AM EST, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Loveland, Maysville, Milford, Hillsboro, Greenfield, Georgetown, Forestville, Amelia, Mount Orab, Bethel, New Richmond, Williamsburg, Terrace Park, Ripley, Aberdeen, Batavia, Lynchburg, Leesburg, Augusta and Marshall.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
